commands.title: Update or install the required R Package

supportsWriteToStdinEvent.description: Whether to use custom events to request text written to R's stdin. Is used to implement next/step/continue requests.

useCustomSocket.description: Whether to use a separate socket for custom events. Usually necessary in attach mode.

customPort.description: Port number of custom socket. Leave emtpy/0 to assign automatically.

customHost.description: Host name of custom socket. Leave empty to use localhost.

port.description: Port number where vscDebugger is listening for DAP messages.

host.description: Host name where vscDebugger is listening for DAP messages.

splitOverwrittenOutput.description: Whether to show the overwritten output in the normal stdout/stderr as well.

overwritePrint.description: Whether to attach a modified print() function (direct calls to base::print are not affected).

overwriteStr.description: Whether to attach a modified str() function (direct calls to base::str are not affected).

overwriteMessage.description: Whether to attach a modified message() function (direct calls to base::message are not affected).

overwriteCat.description: Whether to attach a modified cat() function (direct calls to base::cat are not affected).

overwriteSource.description: Whether to attach a modified source() function (direct calls to base::source are not affected).

setBreakpointsInPackages.description: Whether to enable breakpoints in exported functions from ALL packages. Usually, `debuggedPackages` is preferred.

includePackageScopes.description: Set to true to show package scopes in the variable window.

debuggedPackages.description: Packages to be debugged. Are loaded before launching the R script/file/function, and can contain breakpoints.

debugMode.description: Debug a single main-FUNCTION, run an R FILE, or just start an empty R WORKSPACE

allowGlobalDebugging.description: Whether to allow debugging in the global workspace after running the function/file.

file.description: Absolute path to an R file

mainFunction.description: The name of the main function, if a single function is being debugged. Must be callable without arguments.

overwritePrint.description: Whether to attach a modified print() function (direct calls to base::print are not affected).

overwriteStr.description: Whether to attach a modified str() function (direct calls to base::str are not affected).

overwriteMessage.description: Whether to attach a modified message() function (direct calls to base::message are not affected).

overwriteCat.description: Whether to attach a modified cat() function (direct calls to base::cat are not affected).

overwriteSource.description: Whether to attach a modified source() function (direct calls to base::source are not affected).

setBreakpointsInPackages.description: Whether to enable breakpoints in exported functions from ALL packages. Usually, `debuggedPackages` is preferred.

includePackageScopes.description: Set to true to show package scopes in the variable window.

debuggedPackages.description: Packages to be debugged. Are loaded before launching the R script/file/function, and can contain breakpoints.

rdebugger.rterm.windows.description: R.exe path for Windows. If empty, the registry and PATH are searched for an R executable.

rdebugger.rterm.mac.description: R path for macOS. If empty, the PATH is searched for an R executable.

rdebugger.rterm.linux.description: R path for Linux. If empty, the PATH is searched for an R executable.

rdebugger.timeouts.startup.description: The maximum time in ms that is waited for R to startup. Is also used for some other timeouts.

rdebugger.timeouts.terminate.description: Time in ms that is waited when terminating R to allow messages etc. to appear.

rdebugger.timeouts.prompt.description: Time in ms that is waited before handling input prompts on stdout (to avoid async issues).

rdebugger.checkVersion.description: Whether to check the version of the R package before launching the debugger.

rdebugger.trackTerminals.description: Whether to track terminals opened while using the extension. Recommended for debugging in attached mode on windows.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
